params._applications: Indexes of the applications to accept.

params._requestType: What kind of request it is.

params._reward: Wanted rewards for completing the task.

params._explanation: Why the task was cancelled. (IPFS hash)

params._newMetadata: New description of the task. (IPFS hash)

params._budget: Maximum ERC20 rewards that can be earned by completing the task.
params._deadline: Block timestamp at which the task expires if not completed.

returns.taskId: Id of the newly created task.

params._explanation: Why the executor should be dropped.

params._executor: The executor to fetch tasks of.
params._max: The maximum amount of tasks to return. 0 for no max.
The maximum amount of tasks to return. 0 for no max.
params._proposer: The proposer to fetch tasks of.

params._submission: Index of the submission that is reviewed.

params._application: Index of application you made that has been accepted.

acceptApplications(uint256,uint16[]).notice: Accept application to allow them to take the task.

acceptRequest(uint256,uint8,uint8).notice: Accepts a request, executing the proposed action.

cancelTask(uint256,string).notice: Cancels a task. This can be used to close a task and receive back the budget.

changeScope(uint256,string,uint64,(bool,.notice: Change the scope of the task. This updates the description, deadline and reward of the task.

dropExecutor(uint256,string).notice: Drops the current executor of the task

getExecutingTasks(address,uint256,uint25.notice: Retrieves all tasks of an executor. Most recent ones first.

getProposingTasks(address,uint256,uint25.notice: Retrieves all tasks of a proposer. Most recent ones first.

getTask(uint256).notice: Retrieves all task information by id.

takeTask(uint256,uint16).notice: Take the task after your application has been accepted.

taskCount().notice: Retrieves the current amount of created tasks.

taskStatistics().notice: Retrieves the current statistics of created tasks.
